page.title: 15ARABLE FARMING.
page.content: In this 12sq.km.block,11sq.km.are given over to farming.That is about 2700 acres.Of this,about 23% is under permanent pasture.The rest is arable farmland.By far the most important crop is{WHEAT.}About 29% is now under {WINTER WHEAT}(sown at the end of last year) with a further 4.5% under{SPRING sown{WHEAT.}The second major crop is {BARLEY.}With{SPRING BARLEY}and{WINTER {BARLEY}together there is about 15%. The rest is shared between root crops like{POTATOES}and{SUGAR BEET,}cash crops like{OILSEED RAPE,KALE}and{PEAS, and the fodder crops{HAY}and{SILAGE. The root crops have a little more land than the other "rotational" crops. Farming methods are much the same as anywhere else,although,with such an intensive use of the land,correct and sufficient use of fertiliser is very important for the soil fertility.
